thread.title: NY WFO BINGHAMTON Warnings, Watches, and Advisories
thread.title_full: NY WFO BINGHAMTON Warnings, Watches, and Advisories

author: Accuweather
title: NY WFO BINGHAMTON Warnings, Watches, and Advisories
text:
WFO BINGHAMTON Warnings, Watches and Advisories for Saturday, March 23, 2024
WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY
URGENT - WINTER WEATHER MESSAGE
National Weather Service Binghamton NY
304 PM EDT Fri Mar 22 2024
...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT
SATURDAY...
* WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of
2 to 5 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze.
* WHERE...Yates, Seneca, Southern Cayuga, Onondaga and Steuben
counties.
* WHEN...Until 2 PM EDT Saturday.
* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the evening commute.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A wintry mix of snow, sleet, and freezing
rain will move in this afternoon, and likely remain a mix of
precipitation through Saturday afternoon. Precipitation will
likely remain as snow from Syracuse northward.
PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...
Slow down and use caution while traveling.
The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
* WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Additional snow
accumulations of 4 to 6 inches and ice accumulations of a light
glaze to one tenth of an inch.
* WHERE...Madison and Southern Oneida counties.
* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will move into the area this
afternoon, before mixing with sleet, freezing rain, and rain
overnight and early Saturday morning. Precipitation likely
changes back to snow by late Saturday morning.
...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS
EVENING TO 2 PM EDT SATURDAY...
up to 3 inches and ice accumulations up to one tenth of an
inch.
* WHERE...Otsego, Delaware and Sullivan counties.
* WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 2 PM EDT Saturday.
* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
rain will develop this evening, before changing to mainly rain
Saturday morning. Freezing rain will hold on the longest at
elevations greater than 2000 feet. The greatest snow and ice
accumulations will be across northern portions of Otsego
county.
...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 PM
EDT SATURDAY...
* WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow
accumulations of 6 to 12 inches and ice accumulations of up to
a quarter of an inch.
* WHERE...The Saratoga Springs and Glens Falls areas and southern
Vermont.
* WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 11 PM EDT Saturday.
* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult due to snow and ice
covered roadways and reduced visibility. The heavy wet snow may
lead to some downed tree limbs, resulting in some power
outages.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates may approach one inch per
hour late tonight into early Saturday.
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.
accumulations of 6 to 10 inches and ice accumulations of around
one tenth of an inch.
* WHERE...Northern Fulton County.

...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO
11 PM EDT SATURDAY...
accumulations of 8 to 14 inches and ice accumulations of
around one tenth of an inch.
* WHERE...Northern Herkimer, Hamilton, Northern Warren and
Northern Washington Counties.
...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO
* WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations
of 2 to 6 inches and ice accumulations of around one tenth of
an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph.
* WHERE...The Capital Region of eastern New York.
* IMPACTS...Travel could be hazardous due to snow and ice covered
roadways and reduced visibility.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and sleet tonight will change to
freezing rain and plain rain on Saturday morning. After a period
of plain rain, precipitation will change back to snow before
ending late Saturday. Snowfall rates may get close to one inch
per hour late Saturday before precipitation ends. The highest
snow totals will be for northern parts of the Capital Region.
...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING
TO 11 PM EDT SATURDAY...
2 to 6 inches and ice accumulations of up to a quarter of an
inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph.
* WHERE...The Mohawk and Schoharie Valleys, Helderbergs and
eastern Catskills.
snow totals will be for northern areas.
...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING
* WHERE...In Massachusetts, Northern Berkshire and Southern
Berkshire Counties. In New York, Eastern Rensselaer and
Eastern Columbia Counties.
* WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 11 PM EDT Saturday.
* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions due to snow and ice
covered roadways and reduced visibility.
